title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Office of Environmental Education is established. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act (20 U.S.C. 5503) is amended to include support that is balanced and scientifically sound, reorganize paragraphs, and expand access through headquarters and regional offices of the Agency. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support, reorganize paragraphs, and expand access through headquarters and regional offices of the Agency. The Office of Environmental Education will have a headquarters staff of up to 10 employees and be supported by one employee in each regional office. The Administrator may carry out activities directly or through grants, agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3. ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION GRANTS amended to reduce funding for lobbying activities. SEC. 4. ENVIRONMENTAL INTERNSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS introduced. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by striking sections 7 through 11 and redesignating them as sections 7 through 10. Conforming amendments are made to the table of contents and section 4(b). In amendments to the National Environmental Education Act, sections 7 through 11 are struck and redesignated as sections 7 through 10. Changes are made in section 4(b) and other sections to reflect the renumbering. In amendments to the National Environmental Education Act, sections 7 through 11 are redesignated as sections 7 through 10. Changes are made in section 4(b) and other sections to reflect the renumbering. Additionally, subsections in section 10 are modified by replacing references to specific sections with updated subsections. SEC. 5. National Education Awards. The Administrator may provide awards known as the 'President's Environmental Youth Awards' to young people in grades K-12 for outstanding projects promoting local environmental awareness. SEC. 6. Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act amends the composition of the Advisory Council to consist of up to 11 members appointed by the Administrator, with representation from various sectors including education, universities, non-profit organizations, and state departments of education. The National Environmental Education Act amends the Advisory Council composition to include representatives from federal agencies engaged in environmental education. Biennial meetings will address timely issues and provide recommendations. The National Environmental Education Act will amend the Advisory Council composition to include representatives from federal agencies engaged in environmental education. Biennial meetings will address timely issues and provide recommendations. The Council will also issue a report on the proceedings of the meeting. SEC. 7. NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOUNDATION. The name of the National Environmental Education Act is changed to the Foundation for Environmental Education. Amendments are made to reflect this name change in the Act. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name to the Foundation for Environmental Education. This change is reflected in various sections of the Act. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to change the name to the Foundation for Environmental Education in various sections of the Act. The National Environmental Education Act is amended to increase the number of directors on the Board of Directors from 13 to 19 and remove paragraph (3) regarding conditions of donations. SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007, with specific funding amounts allocated for each year. There are limitations on the use of funds, with not more than 25 percent allowed for certain purposes. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency with specific funding allocations for different activities. Funds are limited in their use, with percentages designated for various purposes such as environmental education grants and administrative expenses. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency, with specific funding allocations for activities of the Office of Environmental Education. Not more than 25 percent of the funds may be used for administrative expenses. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of this Act.
